wesm commented on pull request #6203: ARROW-7518: [Python] Use PYARROW_WITH_HDFS when building wheels, conda packages
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6203#discussion_r367070345
 
 

 ##########
 File path: dev/tasks/conda-recipes/arrow-cpp/bld.bat
 ##########
 @@ -21,6 +21,7 @@ cmake -G "Ninja" ^
       -DARROW_PYTHON:BOOL=ON ^
       -DARROW_MIMALLOC:BOOL=ON ^
       -DARROW_FLIGHT:BOOL=ON ^
+      -DARROW_HDFS:BOOL=ON ^
 
 Review comment:
   Note this isn't needed
   
   https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/cpp/CMakeLists.txt#L289
   
   Is `pyarrow._hdfs` optional now?

kszucs commented on pull request #6203: ARROW-7518: [Python] Use PYARROW_WITH_HDFS when building wheels, conda packages
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6203#discussion_r368656608
 
 

 ##########
 File path: dev/tasks/conda-recipes/arrow-cpp/bld.bat
 ##########
 @@ -21,6 +21,7 @@ cmake -G "Ninja" ^
       -DARROW_PYTHON:BOOL=ON ^
       -DARROW_MIMALLOC:BOOL=ON ^
       -DARROW_FLIGHT:BOOL=ON ^
+      -DARROW_HDFS:BOOL=ON ^
 
 Review comment:
   We have two filesystem implementations, the old python one and the new C++ implementation. `_hdfs` and `_s3` are the bindings for the C++ implementation. `pyarrow.hdfs` is not optional but `pyarrow._hdfs` (exposed under `pyarrow.fs`) is optional.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

kszucs commented on pull request #6203: ARROW-7518: [Python] Use PYARROW_WITH_HDFS when building wheels, conda packages
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6203#discussion_r368656608
 
 

 ##########
 File path: dev/tasks/conda-recipes/arrow-cpp/bld.bat
 ##########
 @@ -21,6 +21,7 @@ cmake -G "Ninja" ^
       -DARROW_PYTHON:BOOL=ON ^
       -DARROW_MIMALLOC:BOOL=ON ^
       -DARROW_FLIGHT:BOOL=ON ^
+      -DARROW_HDFS:BOOL=ON ^
 
 Review comment:
   We have two filesystem implementations, the old python one for the python fs and the new C++ implementation for the new `arrow::fs`. `_hdfs` and `_s3` are the bindings for the C++ implementation. `pyarrow.hdfs` is not optional but `pyarrow._hdfs` (exposed under `pyarrow.fs`) is optional.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description: This new module is not enabled in the package builds
fields.summary: [Python] Use PYARROW_WITH_HDFS when building wheels, conda packages

comments.body: I assume this is being tested in GHA?
We have a GHA cron job and a crossbow nightly to tests the hdfs integration.
Both GHA cron and crossbow nightly sounds redundant. Given our current state of the art, I think we should prefer crossbow (better reporting, ability to trigger on demand)
